intro: Jatropha purpurea, commonly known as the purple cupplant, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple bracts that surround its small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and can reach heights of up to six feet. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules that contain toxic seeds. Jatropha purpurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
